title: what would be the ideal typeface to portray the 60's
content:
hello,

does anybody have any ideas of typefaces i could use for a 60's booklet and poster, I am re-creating a collective celebration about Roger McGough (the poet) for one of my final year pieces at university.

any inputs would be great thanks.

:-)
author: co-co

comments.content:
Try with Helvetica... ;-)  
or, if you prefer a 60's-like typeface, try to imitate the Wes Wilson posters  
 [http://www.fontcraft.com/scriptorium/psychedelic.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20100520041110/http:/www.fontcraft.com/scriptorium/psychedelic.html "http://www.fontcraft.com/scriptorium/psychedelic.html")  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/hihretrofonts/roller-poster/familytree.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20100520041110/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/hihretrofonts/roller-poster/familytree.html "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/hihretrofonts/roller-poster/familytree.html")
